title: Hover Effects
ques: How can you change the background color of a button when the user hovers over it?
explanation:
The ```:hover``` pseudo-class is used to apply styles when the user hovers over an element.

- ```button:hover``` â†’ Targets the ```<button>``` element when hovered.
- ```background-color: blue;``` â†’ Changes the background color to blue.
- ```color: white;``` â†’ Changes the text color to white.

title: ::before Pseudo-element
ques: How can you add content before a heading using CSS?
explanation:
The ```::before``` pseudo-element is used to insert content before an element.

- ```h1::before``` â†’ Targets all ```<h1>``` elements.
- ```content: 'â˜… ';``` â†’ Inserts a star symbol before the text.
- ```color: gold;``` â†’ Colors the star gold.

title: ::after Pseudo-element
ques: How can you add a decorative line after a heading using CSS?
explanation:
The ```::after``` pseudo-element is used to insert content after an element.

- ```h1::after``` â†’ Targets all ```<h1>``` elements.
- ```content: '';``` â†’ Ensures an empty content box is created.
- ```display: block;``` â†’ Makes it behave like a block element.
- ```width: 100%;``` â†’ Makes it span the full width of the heading.
- ```height: 3px;``` â†’ Sets the height of the line.
- ```background-color: black;``` â†’ Colors the line black.

title: nth-child Selector
ques: How can you style every even row of a table?
explanation:
The ```:nth-child(n)``` pseudo-class selects elements based on their order.

- ```tr:nth-child(even)``` â†’ Selects all even rows in a ```<table>```.
- ```background-color: lightgray;``` â†’ Sets the background color to light gray.

title: Hover Image Opacity
ques: How can you reduce the opacity of an image when the user hovers over it?
explanation: The ```:hover``` pseudo-class applies styles when an element is hovered over. - ```img:hover``` â†’ Targets all `````` elements when hovered. - ```opacity: 0.5;``` â†’ Reduces the image's opacity to 50%. - ```transition: opacity 0.3s ease;``` â†’ Smoothly transitions the opacity change over 0.3 seconds.

title: Highlight the First Letter
ques: How can you make the first letter of a paragraph larger and a different color?
explanation:
The ```::first-letter``` pseudo-element targets the first letter of an element. - ```p::first-letter``` â†’ Selects the first letter of all ```

``` elements. - ```font-size: 2em;``` â†’ Makes the letter twice the normal font size. - ```color: blue;``` â†’ Changes the letter color to blue. - ```font-weight: bold;``` â†’ Makes the letter bold.

title: Styling Links Based on Visit
ques: How can you style a link differently if it has been visited before?
explanation:
The ```:visited``` pseudo-class applies styles to links that have been visited.

- ```a:visited``` â†’ Targets all ```<a>``` elements that have been clicked before.
- ```color: purple;``` â†’ Changes the color of visited links to purple.

title: Style Only the Last Child
ques: How can you apply a different background color only to the last item in a list?
explanation:
The ```:last-child``` pseudo-class selects the last child of a parent element.

- ```li:last-child``` â†’ Targets only the last ```<li>``` inside a ```<ul>``` or ```<ol>```.
- ```background-color: yellow;``` â†’ Changes the last list itemâ€™s background color to yellow.

title: Adding a Decorative Border Before a Heading
ques: How can you add a vertical border before an ```<h2>``` heading?
explanation:
The ```::before``` pseudo-element is used to insert content before an element.

- ```h2::before``` â†’ Targets all ```<h2>``` elements.
- ```content: '';``` â†’ Creates an empty content box.
- ```display: inline-block;``` â†’ Ensures it behaves like an inline element.
- ```width: 5px; height: 100%;``` â†’ Creates a thin vertical border.
- ```background-color: red;``` â†’ Sets the color of the border.
- ```margin-right: 10px;``` â†’ Adds spacing between the border and text.

title: Create a Tooltip with ::after
ques: How can you show a tooltip when a user hovers over a button using ```::after```?
explanation:
The ```::after``` pseudo-element is used to insert content after an element.

- ```button:hover::after``` â†’ Adds content only when the button is hovered.
- ```content: 'Click me!';``` â†’ Displays the tooltip text.
- ```display: block;``` â†’ Ensures the tooltip appears as a block element.
- ```background: black; color: white;``` â†’ Styles the tooltip for readability.
- ```padding: 5px;``` â†’ Adds space inside the tooltip.
- ```position: absolute;``` â†’ Positions the tooltip relative to the button.
- ```top: -30px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%);``` â†’ Centers the tooltip above the button.
- ```border-radius: 5px;``` â†’ Rounds the corners of the tooltip.

title: Targeting Even and Odd Rows in a Table
ques: How can you apply different background colors to even and odd rows of a table?
explanation:
The ```:nth-child()``` pseudo-class selects elements based on their order.

- ```tr:nth-child(even)``` â†’ Selects even-numbered ```<tr>``` elements.
- ```background-color: #f2f2f2;``` â†’ Sets a light gray background for even rows.
- ```tr:nth-child(odd)``` â†’ Selects odd-numbered ```<tr>``` elements.
- ```background-color: white;``` â†’ Ensures odd rows have a white background.

title: Underline Only on Hover
ques: How can you make a link appear without an underline but show an underline when hovered?
explanation:
The ```:hover``` pseudo-class changes styles when the user hovers over an element.

- ```a { text-decoration: none; }``` â†’ Removes the underline from all links.
- ```a:hover { text-decoration: underline; }``` â†’ Restores the underline when hovered.

title: Style First List Item
ques: How can you make only the first list item bold and blue?
explanation:
The ```:first-child``` pseudo-class selects the first child of a parent element.

- ```li:first-child``` â†’ Targets the first ```<li>``` inside a ```<ul>``` or ```<ol>```.
- ```font-weight: bold;``` â†’ Makes the text bold.
- ```color: blue;``` â†’ Changes the text color to blue.

title: Custom Checkbox Styling
ques: How can you style checkboxes using the ```:checked``` pseudo-class?
explanation:
The ```:checked``` pseudo-class applies styles to checked checkboxes.

- ```input[type='checkbox']:checked``` â†’ Targets checked checkboxes.
- ```+ label``` â†’ Styles the label next to the checked checkbox.
- ```color: green;``` â†’ Changes the label text color to green.
- ```font-weight: bold;``` â†’ Makes the label text bold.

title: Custom Placeholder Text Color
ques: How can you change the color of placeholder text inside an input field?
explanation:
The ```::placeholder``` pseudo-element styles placeholder text inside input fields.

- ```input::placeholder``` â†’ Selects placeholder text inside ```<input>```.
- ```color: gray;``` â†’ Changes placeholder text color to gray.
- ```font-style: italic;``` â†’ Makes placeholder text italic.

title: Change Button Color on Focus
ques: How can you change a buttonâ€™s background color when it is focused?
explanation:
The ```:focus``` pseudo-class applies styles when an element is focused.

- ```button:focus``` â†’ Targets buttons when clicked or tabbed to.
- ```background-color: orange;``` â†’ Changes the background color to orange.
- ```outline: none;``` â†’ Removes the default focus outline.

title: Style Input When Empty
ques: How can you style an input field only when it's empty?
explanation:
The ```:empty``` pseudo-class selects elements that contain no children.

- ```input:empty``` â†’ Targets empty input fields.
- ```border: 2px dashed red;``` â†’ Adds a red dashed border to highlight the empty field.

title: Make Even List Items Italic
ques: How can you make only even list items italic?
explanation:
The ```:nth-child(even)``` pseudo-class selects even-numbered elements.

- ```li:nth-child(even)``` â†’ Targets every second list item.
- ```font-style: italic;``` â†’ Makes the text italic.

title: Custom Cursor on Hover
ques: How can you change the cursor to a pointer when hovering over a div?
explanation:
The ```:hover``` pseudo-class applies styles when an element is hovered over.

- ```div:hover``` â†’ Targets ```<div>``` elements when hovered.
- ```cursor: pointer;``` â†’ Changes the cursor to a hand icon.

title: Add a Decorative Line After a Heading
ques: How can you add a horizontal line after an ```<h1>``` heading?
explanation:
The ```::after``` pseudo-element adds content after an element.

- ```h1::after``` â†’ Targets ```<h1>``` elements.
- ```content: '';``` â†’ Creates an empty content block.
- ```display: block;``` â†’ Ensures it takes up space below the heading.
- ```width: 100%; height: 2px;``` â†’ Creates a horizontal line.
- ```background-color: black;``` â†’ Colors the line black.
- ```margin-top: 10px;``` â†’ Adds space between the heading and line.
